channel.title: Sizzling Summer Blowout
channel.description:
To help sizzle up your summer, every day over the course of August and September, RuneScape members will receive a host of summer goodies. Be a member through all of August and receive 350,000 XP (at the end of the month) and an extra bonus spin every day! Stay a member throughout September too and we'll double it! That's 700,000XP and 2 extra spins every day in September. To get you further into the summer mood, stay a member throughout August and September and you'll also receive 9 new customisation items, including a 5-piece Tropical Islander outfit, extra head & cape accessories, a new title and even a wild Crab Transformation Dance emote! With over $45 worth of items and spins included, this really is a scorching Summer sensation! Hot enough? Well, if all of this wasn't enough, players who are members for the entirety of the Sizzling Summer (1st August GMT until 30th September GMT) will also have the envious chance to CHOOSE YOUR FATE! CHOOSE YOUR FATE is a selection of four of the most powerful items ever seen in RuneScape. More exciting details on this next week! We promise you will not want to miss out on this and much much more… Make sure you're a member throughout August and September to take part. So keep calm and party on. The RuneScape Team
I'm curious as to what exactly the CHOOSE YOUR FATE thing is. Either way, it looks like I'm buying membership through September, as it seems fairly interesting.

item.title: Sizzling Summer Blowout
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“xEthanx, post:34, topic:450522”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=553410.msg4061123#msg4061123 date=1343432443]

They’re trying to find loopholes to make people stay, when all they need to do is bring back the old fucking game.
[/quote]Incorrect. You’re on a RSPS community (IE, people that have [mostly] left the real RS scene, with a few exceptions), so of course that’s what the general idea is. However there are plenty of people that like the game as-is. Well, I should say, they prefer it now over the game it was back then (content wise, not community wise). However, if they reverted back to an older revision, I think I can pretty much guarantee a ton of people would leave, especially ones that have spent a lot of time working on the new things. Adding new servers for old content would probably work, similar to what RSC servers are with them now. However it would be super complicated to do, I doubt they have account backups that old, so everyone would probably be reset or something.

How come they lost like 2/3 of their player population as soon as they made these updates? It makes the most monetary sense to go back to the old. They’re clearly desperate for money with these stupid little knick knacks like paying for spins and shit. Instead of coming up with 30 ideas that could’ve come from an 8 year old why not just make one logical decision that fixes everything?[/quote]

Did you stop to think of the possiblity that the players who “disappeared” were bots that they took care of?

Read full topic

However it would be super complicated to do, I doubt they have account backups that old, so everyone would probably be reset or something.

How come they lost like 2/3 of their player population as soon as they made these updates? It makes the most monetary sense to go back to the old. They’re clearly desperate for money with these stupid little knick knacks like paying for spins and shit. Instead of coming up with 30 ideas that could’ve come from an 8 year old why not just make one logical decision that fixes everything?[/quote]Where are you getting these numbers? What updates? What are you even talking about? What makes you think the players would come back?

item.title: Sizzling Summer Blowout
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you care enough about the game to even make use of the bonus xp, it’s probably worth buying membership. These incentives to be a member are fine, and are on a completely different scale than the other types of things they are doing.

It still is an extension and always will be. Getting bonus xp is no different than faster training methods members get. If you’re f2p, you lose out on things like this, and that’s how its always been.

Read full topic

item.title: Sizzling Summer Blowout
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

they are pretty much coercing you into buying membership. I can understand that this is a business but it’s another thing when you are pretty much forcing the hard time gamers to pay for membership.

If you remember back in the veteran days they used to claim that “p2p was just an extension” now they have made it like it’s more of a privilege that’s honored by piling their back pockets.

Read full topic

item.title: Sizzling Summer Blowout
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Pink Phat, post:17, topic:450522”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=553410.msg4056019#msg4056019 date=1342968030]
I suspect their will be limitations with this, i.e. with the mad necklace you had to wear it and gain xp. Then it’d be doubled, they will probably do that again or that’d be quite bullshit. Level 1 summoning to 70 from lamps for being members.
[/quote]
although that would suck with dungeoneering if it was a lamp because you wouldn’t get the tokens (I assume).[/quote]
Its not all about the tokkens, 85 dung = frost drags etc. and when your a higher lvl you get more floors = more xp ph.
I’m sure they’ll make it possible for you to use it with dg though.

Read full topic
